trans-unit.source: Provides data for a cancelable event.
A cancelable event is raised when a component is about to perform an action that can be canceled, such as logging on to a Web site.
The LoginCancelEventArgs class provides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginCancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to indicate whether the event should be canceled.

A LoginCancelEventArgs object is used with controls that have cancelable actions, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard> control, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginCancelEventArgs"></xref> class with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginCancelEventArgs.Cancel*> property set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginCancelEventArgs"></xref> class with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginCancelEventArgs.Cancel*> property set to the specified value.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to cancel the event; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the event should be canceled.

You can use the Cancel property to indicate whether an event, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LoggingIn> event, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LoggingOut> event, or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword.ChangingPassword> event, should be canceled.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event should be canceled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
